SEARCH
Package io.github.jspinak.brobot.imageUtils

Class BufferedImageOps

java.lang.Object
io.github.jspinak.brobot.imageUtils.BufferedImageOps
@Component public class BufferedImageOps extends Object
Comprehensive BufferedImage operations for the Brobot GUI automation framework.

BufferedImageOps provides a centralized set of utilities for working with Java's BufferedImage class, bridging the gap between various image representations used throughout the framework. It handles conversions, screen captures, file operations, and format transformations while abstracting platform-specific details.

Key operation categories:

  • File Operations: Loading images from disk with platform abstraction
  • Screen Capture: Capturing screen regions with headless/mock support
  • Format Conversion: Converting between BufferedImage, Mat, and byte arrays
  • Image Manipulation: Extracting sub-images and type conversions
  • Serialization: Base64 encoding/decoding for data transmission

Platform abstraction features:

  • Uses SikuliX for cross-platform file loading when available
  • Falls back to direct file reading in headless environments
  • Provides dummy images for mock/test scenarios
  • Handles various image formats with automatic PNG extension

Integration points:

  • SikuliX: Leverages Pattern class for platform-independent file access
  • OpenCV/JavaCV: Converts between Mat and BufferedImage formats
  • Screen Capture: Integrates with Screen class for region capture
  • Environment Awareness: Adapts behavior based on BrobotEnvironment

Common use cases:

  • Loading pattern images from files for visual matching
  • Capturing screen regions for analysis or comparison
  • Converting images for OpenCV processing
  • Serializing images for network transmission or storage
  • Extracting regions of interest from larger images

In the model-based approach, BufferedImageOps serves as the foundation for all image handling operations. By providing consistent interfaces and handling edge cases like headless environments, it enables the framework to work reliably across different deployment scenarios while maintaining clean separation between image processing and automation logic.

Since:
1.0

      Parameters:
      path - the filename of the image
      Returns:
      the BufferedImage from file

    • getBuffImgDirectly

      public static BufferedImage getBuffImgDirectly(String path)
      To use this method, you need to deal with paths. In SikuliX, there is a bundle path. SikuliX has code to abstract the OS. If you want Brobot to be platform independent, it should use SikuliX as much as possible to retrieve BufferedImages from file.
      Parameters:
      path - the path of the image
      Returns:
      the BufferedImage from an image on file
